column1: Western China (simplified Chinese: 中国西部; traditional Chinese: 大陸西部; pinyin: Zhōngguó Xībù
column2: or rarely simplified Chinese: 华西; traditional Chinese: 華西; pinyin: Huáxī) is the west of China. In the definition of the Chinese government
column3: Western China covers one municipality: Chongqing; six provinces: Sichuan
column8: and Qinghai; and three autonomous regions: Tibet
